children.name: Balitaw
children.description: Folk originating in the Visayas islands of the Philippines; dialogue or debate in which a man and a woman compete at improvising romantic verses.

children.name: Harana
children.description: Hispanic-influenced lyrical courtship music traditionally sung by men, accompanied by guitar based on the danza rhythm.

children.name: Igorot Music
children.description: Traditions of the Igorot people of the Cordillera region in the northern Philippines, known for their gong ensembles.

children.name: Ilocano Music
children.description: Music by the Ilocano people, an ethnic group residing in the northwestern tip of Luzon.

children.name: Kundiman
children.description: Traditional Filipino love songs usually sung in Tagalog.

children.name: OPM
children.description: Filipino ballads prominent in the 1970s to early 1980s, combining the sentimentality, lush arrangements and vocal techniques of Kundiman with the instrumentations and rhythms of Manila Sound and Soft Rock.

children.name: Philippine Rondalla
children.description: Ensemble of plucked string instruments typically performed for traditional Filipino folk dances; known for its distinct sparkling and tinkling tremolo sound.

children.name: Pinoy Folk Rock
children.description: Typically sung in Tagalog and pioneered in the 1970s, incorporating elements of indigenous music such as Kulintang gong music and the kubing bamboo jaw harp.
